summary: Comprehensive testing of The State of Play premium publication platform completed. Backend APIs working well (91.7% success rate), core navigation and paywall functionality operational, but critical React Razorpay integration error preventing Dashboard access.

flaky_endpoints.issue: Returns authentication failure with placeholder Razorpay credentials
flaky_endpoints.impact: Expected - using test keys for design preview

ui_bugs.issue: React runtime error: 'react_razorpay WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_6__default is not a function'

integration_issues.issue: Dashboard inaccessible due to Razorpay import error - prevents subscription status viewing and payment flows

passed_tests: Homepage hero section and article loading
Navigation between Home, State of Play, and Left Field pages
Article filtering by publication (3 premium, 3 free articles)
Signup form and new user creation
Backend API endpoints (articles, auth, subscription status)
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix React Razorpay integration error in Dashboard component. The error 'react_razorpay WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_6__default is not a function' is likely due to React 19 compatibility issues with react-razorpay v3.0.1. Consider downgrading React or updating/replacing the Razorpay integration. This prevents users from accessing dashboard and subscription management.
